snippet: The widening achievement gap between affluent and low-income students has received less attention than the divide between white and black students, which has narrowed significantly.
abstract: Body of scholarship suggests that the achievement gap between rich and poor children in America is widening, a development that threatens to dilute education’s leveling effects; researchers are finding that while the achievement gap between white and black students has narrowed significantly over the past few decades, the gap between rich and poor students has grown substantially during the same period; changes are tectonic, a result of social and economic processes unfolding over many decades.
lead_paragraph: The widening achievement gap between affluent and low-income students has received less attention than the divide between white and black students, which has narrowed significantly.

headline.seo: Education Gap Grows Between Rich and Poor, Studies Show
headline.main: Education Gap Grows Between Rich and Poor, Studies Say
headline.print_headline: Poor Dropping Further Behind Rich in School
